answers.author: Tanya Ange
answers.text:
As of this year, we no longer have a "city clerk" postion.  The responsiblities of our city clerk were distributed as outlined below:  
1) Current city clerk was transferred to Public Safety to fill an adminstrative assistant position.  All licensing and related permits , except rental, are now a part of the position.  We are transition to an egov process for license and permits which will further transition much of the process to 311.  
2) Job descriptions of the City Attorney and City Manager's Office Executive Assistant have been modified to inidicate the two postions fullfill the responsibilities of City Clerk as outlined in State Statute, Charter, and Code. 
3) Our county fully conducts and operates elections and  reimbursed accordingly. We renewed the contract this year.
4) We are transitioning to a electronic records management system.  The "savings" from the Clerk position are being used for the transition (2013).  
5) In the future, the vacant clerk postion will be a community engagment/management analyst postion. 
The transition has worked very well for us.  Let me know if you have questions, Greg.

author: Gregory Stopka
text:
I have a member looking for examples of local governments that have combined their legal director (or paralegal/assistant law director) and a clerk position.  They are considering bringing legal services in-house and possibly merging legal with the clerk function. Anyone have this structure?
Thanks,
Greg Stopka
Central Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
